column4: Is it possible to have Sound Juicer rip CDs faster?  Right now it's only reading at 4.5x for some reason.
Owe me a beer. :-p
Yes, but you forgot to mention OpenGL.
You could also look into Crossover Games.
GnomeBaker
That rips too, huh?  Faster than 4.5x?
Yep.
Actually, gimme one second and I'll check the speed to be sure.
Hmm... I can't even find the option to rip it lol
Or not.  My bad.  It just copies.  Why not just use VLC?
Will that rip to .OGG?
Quick open the disc, then select wizard, transcode as vorbis, select bitrate, save as whatever.  Yeah.
THanks for the tip, but I'm looking for something a little more straightforward - like Sound Juicer but faster than 4.5x (which is ridiculously slow)
And again.. you're more detailed ;)  The program question was my next one.
I've been a tech support slave.
Man, I get so frustrated just telling my mother how to login lol.... over, and over, and over again.
I did AOL support... [there's nothing worse].  And Dell Corporate Business Group, and Dell Small Business.
Worse than AOL could be MS.
I hate totem too, but can't get rid of it without getting rid of the mozilla plugin (the only plugin that works for me)
Eh.  Support for Dell = Windows + Hardware.
Good point.
If you're into comedy, search Google for "neurotically yours tech support" :)
Foamy is my hero.
